name: Might Weaver
text: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

editions.flavor: "Let my strength harden your resolve."
"Let my strength harden your resolve."

name: Mighty Emergence
text: Whenever a creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may put two +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: Why settle for mere enormity?

name: Mighty Leap
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:

—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard

name: Mijae Djinn
text: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

name: Mikaeus, the Lunarch
text:
Mikaeus, the Lunarch enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mikaeus.
{T}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mikaeus: Put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

name: Mikaeus, the Unhallowed
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.
Other non-Human creatures you control get +1/+1 and have undying. (When a creature with undying dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Mikokoro, Center of the Sea
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Each player draws a card.

editions.flavor:
"Center of the Sea, Eye of the World, Shrine of Enlightenment. Seek it for answers. Seek it for healing. Seek it and return transformed."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Minamo

name: Militant Inquisitor
text: Militant Inquisitor gets +1/+0 for each Equipment you control.

editions.flavor: "I am an instrument of the church wielded against Avacyn's enemies."

name: Militant Monk
text:
Vigilance
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Military Intelligence
text: Whenever you attack with two or more creatures, draw a card.

editions.flavor: To know the battlefield is to anticipate the enemy. To know the enemy is to anticipate victory.

name: Militia's Pride
text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token that's tapped and attacking.

editions.flavor: If you pick a fight with one kithkin, be ready to fight them all.

name: Millennial Gargoyle
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"You've got to keep your wits about you on the roofs. Not all stones are compliant handholds."
—Iveta, rooftop runner

name: Millikin
text: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.
The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.

name: Millstone
text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

name: Mimeofacture
text:
Replicate {3}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Choose target permanent an opponent controls. Search that player's library for a card with the same name and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Mimic Vat
text:
Imprint — Whenever a nontoken creature dies, you may exile that card. If you do, return each other card exiled with Mimic Vat to its owner's graveyard.
{3}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of a card exiled with Mimic Vat. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Miming Slime
text: Create an X/X green Ooze creature token, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"We paid the Simic very well for this capability, but we should quickly recoup our expenses in saved wages."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Mina and Denn, Wildborn
text:
You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
{R}{G}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Greenweaver Mina and her twin brother Denn lead the last of the Mul Daya into an uncertain future.

name: Minamo
text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player may draw a card. 
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, each player may return a blue card from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

name: Minamo, School at Water's Edge
text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{U}, {T}: Untap target legendary permanent.

editions.flavor: Its students graduate the school and enter history.

name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
text:
Defender
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.

editions.flavor: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.
The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

name: Minamo Sightbender
text: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.
Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.

name: Minamo's Meddling
text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller reveals his or her hand, then discards each card with the same name as a card spliced onto that spell.

editions.flavor: Like storm water through the segments of bamboo, the spell followed the links of magic. Then it destroyed them.

name: Mind Bend
text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"The world, I've come to realize, is a blank canvas on which to paint."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Mindbender Spores
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Whenever Mindbender Spores blocks a creature, put four fungus counters on that creature. The creature gains "This creature doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a fungus counter on it" and "At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fungus counter from this creature."

name: Mindblaze
text: Name a nonland card and choose a number greater than 0. Target player reveals his or her library. If that library contains exactly the chosen number of the named card, Mindblaze deals 8 damage to that player. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Mind Bomb
text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

name: Mindbreak Trap
text:
If an opponent cast three or more spells this turn, you may pay {0} rather than pay Mindbreak Trap's mana cost.
Exile any number of target spells.

editions.flavor:
"Life is a maze. This is one of its dead ends."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Mind Burst
text: Target player discards X cards, where X is one plus the number of cards named Mind Burst in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: As haunting as a zombie's curse.

name: Mindclaw Shaman
text: When Mindclaw Shaman enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may cast an instant or sorcery card from it without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: Nicol Bolas gives power to those who will abuse it most.

name: Mind Control
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

"The mind: a great weapon and an even greater weakness."
—Jace Beleren

"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

"Every primitive mind has a motive. Easy to find, and eminently exploitable."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Mindcrank
text: Whenever an opponent loses life, that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Damage dealt by sources without infect causes loss of life.)

editions.flavor:
"Let go of your memories and be reborn."
—Argent Etchings, plate 106, passage 27

name: Mindculling
text: You draw two cards and target opponent discards two cards.

editions.flavor:
"Why infiltrate their strongholds when what we seek resides in such a poorly guarded safe?"
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

name: Mind Extraction
text:
As an additional cost to cast Mind Extraction, sacrifice a creature.
Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of each of the sacrificed creature's colors.

name: Mindeye Drake
text:
Flying
When Mindeye Drake dies, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: They can map both the cityscape and the minds of its architects.

name: Mind Funeral
text: Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until four land cards are revealed. That player puts all cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."
—Sharuum the Hegemon

"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."
—Sharuum the Hegemon

name: Mind Games
text:
Buyback {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Mind Grind
text: Each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals X land cards, then puts all cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard. X can't be 0.

name: Mind Harness
text:
Enchant red or green creature
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
You control enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.

name: Mind Knives
text: Target opponent discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.

name: Mindlash Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this permanent: Each player discards a card."

editions.flavor: Though Dominaria's queenless slivers lack a single purpose, in some the instinct for self-sacrifice remains extremely strong.

name: Mindleech Mass
text:
Trample
Whenever Mindleech Mass deals combat damage to a player, you may look at that player's hand. If you do, you may cast a nonland card in it without paying that card's mana cost.

name: Mindless Automaton
text:
Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

name: Mindless Null
text: Mindless Null can't block unless you control a Vampire.

editions.flavor: Only a bloodchief can create vampires. The rest sire nulls, who become mindless beasts in their former bodies.

name: Mindlock Orb
text: Players can't search libraries.

editions.flavor: Rogue mechanists once rummaged through the wastes of the Tidehollow, constructing unauthorized golems to threaten the hegemony of the sphinxes. The orbs put a stop to that.

name: Mind Maggots
text: When Mind Maggots enters the battlefield, discard any number of creature cards. For each card discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Mind Maggots.

name: Mindmelter
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Mindmelter can't be blocked.
{3}{C}: Target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Mindmoil
text: Whenever you cast a spell, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.

editions.flavor:
"My criticism of the Izzet is that their impulse for learning seems too much like impulse and too little like learning."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Mind Over Matter
text: Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."

name: Mind Peel
text:
Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)

name: Mind Raker

Devoid (This card has no color.)
When Mind Raker enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, each opponent discards a card.

editions.flavor: It consumes any dreams of victory.

name: Mind Ravel
text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.
An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.

text:
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Mindreaver, exile the top three cards of target player's library.

name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.

editions.flavor:
"The Ojutai are my favorite victims. They have so much knowledge to lose."
—Asmala, Silumgar sorcerer

"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

"What a pity. You should have written it down."
—Liliana Vess

"It saddens me to lose a source of inspiration. This one seemed especially promising."
—Ashiok
What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

Flying

Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

name: Mind's Dilation
text: Whenever an opponent casts his or her first spell each turn, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: Infinite wisdom cannot be contained within a single mind.

name: Mind's Eye
text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Ideas drift like petals on the wind. I have only to lift my face to the breeze."
Developed and tested by researchers at the Consulate's House of Knowledge, these devices allow anyone to see with a visionary's eye.

text: Target player discards X cards at random.

text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Mindslicer
text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards his or her hand.

It is the thing that goes bump in the night.

name: Mind Spring
text: Draw X cards.

text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

name: Mindstatic
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {6}.

editions.flavor:

—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.

({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
{T}: Tap target creature.

Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Minister of Pain exploits a creature, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Draconic words need not be shouted. A whisper will suffice.

"Look at that. Shuffling, wobbling, entrails placed haphazardly. It's shameful. Who would let that kind of work flap about for all to see?"
—Lestin, necromancer

name: Minotaur Aggressor
text: First strike, haste
